quote.text: I am the wisest man alive for I know one thing, and that is that I know nothing
quote.author: Socrates

quote.text: Any man who reads too much and uses his own brain too little falls into lazy habits of thinking.
quote.author: David Brinkley

quote.text: Failure is simply the opportunity to begin again, this time more intelligently.
quote.author: Henry Ford

quote.text: Anyone who has never made a mistake has never tried anything new.
quote.author: Albert Einstein

quote.text: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.
quote.author: Oscar Wilde

quote.text: An excellent man; he has no enemies; and none of his friends like him.
quote.author: Oscar Wilde

quote.text: We are what we repeatedly do; excellence, then, is not an act but a habit.
quote.author: Aristotle

quote.text: Believe those who are seeking the truth. Doubt those who find it.
quote.author: André Gide

quote.text: Be smarter than other people, just don't tell them so.
quote.author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

quote.text: Really great people make you feel that you, too, can become great.
quote.author: Mark Twain

quote.text: True friends stab you in the front.
quote.author: Oscar Wilde

quote.text: So many books, so little time.
quote.author: Frank Zappa

quote.text: To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all.
quote.author: Oscar Wilde

quote.text: The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool
quote.author: William Shakespeare

quote.text: Eagles may soar high, but weasels don't get sucked into jet engines.
quote.author: David Brent

quote.text: Experience is one thing you can't get for nothing.
quote.author: Oscar Wilde

quote.text: If one cannot enjoy reading a book over and over again, there is no use in reading it at all.
quote.author: Oscar Wilde

quote.text: Patriotism is the virtue of the vicious.
quote.author: Oscar Wilde
